name: Jessica Chen

photo.description: A candid photo of a young woman in her 20s sitting at a café, smiling at her laptop.

quote: I like looking at flowers, even if I don’t always buy them, it makes me happy.
keyGoals: Find simple, affordable flowers that feel special.
keyBehaviors: She may not buy flowers often, but she’ll pick them up on impulse if something catches her eye.
Is drawn to visuals and artistic arrangements.
Doesn’t know much about floral types.

environment.description: A cozy, creative home setup, laptop open with design tools, maybe mood boards or sketches, a small vase of flowers on the desk for inspiration.

painPoints: Browses for inspiration but finds florist sites uninspiring.
Wants affordable options but sees only premium arrangements.
opportunities: Inspiring gallery with seasonal themes and mood-based browsing.

name: Carlos Rivera

photo.description: A candid photo of a young man in his early 30s rushing into a store or on his phone while commuting, city buildings in the background, with a slightly hurried look.

quote: I need something fast, I don’t want to show up empty-handed.
keyGoals: Receive recommendations based on occasion or price.
keyBehaviors: Avoids the stress of picking through options or variety.
Values speed, same-day delivery, and ready-to-go options.

environment.description: An office space with a busy environment.

painPoints: Struggles on sites not optimized for mobile.
opportunities: Same-day delivery option with cutoff clearly shown.

name: Emily Johnson

photo.description: A candid photo of a stylish woman in her 40s checking floral centerpieces or arranging floral decorations at an event.

quote: The right flowers can make or break an event's atmosphere.
keyGoals: Find creative, fresh, and unique arrangements for events and clients.
Get deals or promos for bulk purchases, and prefers scheduled calls for them.
Stay up to date on stock information.
keyBehaviors: Appreciates flower or arrangement details and information, and how to care for them.
Buys in large quantities for events.
Is always conscious of the stock of certain flowers she needs.

environment.description: A creative workspace with buckets of flowers, ribbons, décor items, and sketches of designs.

painPoints: Event planners want to know "what’s in stock."
Bulk ordering isn’t always easy online.
opportunities: Live inventory updates on the website.

name: Karen Mitchell

photo.description: A candid photo of a woman in her mid-30s at a tidy home desk, with a planner, sticky notes, or a calendar in the frame, showing she likes to keep things scheduled.

quote: I like to plan ahead so I never miss an important occasion, and I want great value while I’m at it.
keyGoals: Schedule flower gifts ahead of time for birthdays, anniversaries, and holidays.
Receive reliable reminders so nothing is forgotten.
Make sure her gifts feel thoughtful and well-prepared.
Stay within a budget and feel she’s getting good value.
keyBehaviors: Compares options for the best deal before finalizing.

environment.description: A tidy desk with a laptop, a paper planner, a coffee mug, and maybe a phone.

painPoints: Struggles to find websites that allow advance scheduling with reminders.
Gets frustrated if delivery reliability is inconsistent.
opportunities: Support scheduled orders with automated reminders.
Delivery scheduling with clear cutoff times and confirmation tracking.
Display budget-friendly bundles and promotional discounts.

name: Lily da Floris

photo.description: A candid photo of a woman in her 40s, wearing an apron arranging flowers in a shop, behind the counter.

quote: I want my website to make ordering easy, so I can spend more time designing.
keyGoals: More time for the creative side.
keyBehaviors: Balances creativity with running the business.

environment.description: A flower shop with a counter and a work station.

painPoints: Spends too much time managing orders manually.
Needs features to encourage repeat business.
